sect2.title: Introduction to Zip
sect2.para: The Zip package contains Zip utilities. These are useful for compressing files into ZIP archives.

sect2.title: Installation of Zip
sect2.para: Install Zip by running the following commands:

userinput.command: make prefix=/usr -f unix/Makefile generic_gcc && make prefix=/usr -f unix/Makefile install

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: make prefix=/usr -f unix/Makefile generic_gcc: This command overrides the prefix variable that is set to /usr/local in the unix/Makefile which is used as a Makefile and builds the executables for a Linux system. The alternatives to 'generic_gcc' can be seen with a make -f unix/Makefile list command.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Zip package contains zip, zipcloak, zipnote and zipsplit.

sect3.title: zip
sect3.para: zip compresses files into a ZIP archive.

sect3.title: zipcloak
sect3.para: zipcloak is disabled in this version of Zip. It will display a message about how to support encryption by recompiling with zcrypt27.zip.

sect3.title: zipnote
sect3.para: zipnote reads or writes comments stored in a ZIP file.

sect3.title: zipsplit
sect3.para: zipsplit is a utility to split ZIP files into smaller files.
